page.title: 12ABOUT OUR SCHOOLS
page.content: THE THREE SCHOOLS WHICH HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE STUDY OF THIS PART OF CHELTENHAM ARE{HOLY TRINITY {PRIMARY, LYNWORTH PRIMARY AND WHADDON {PRIMARY.}HOLY TRINITY IS THE OLDEST AND SMALLEST OF THE THREE, AND IS A CHURCH SCHOOL FOUNDED DURING THE 19TH CENTURY. WHADDON SCHOOL IS ABOUT 50 YEARS OLD AND WAS BUILT TO SERVE THE THEN NEW HOUSING ESTATE. IT HAS A ROLL OF ABOUT 250 PUPILS WHICH IS A LITTLE MORE THAN A HALF OF ITS FORMER SIZE. THE SCHOOL USES THE PUBLIC PLAYING FIELD IN THE MIDDLE OF CLYDE CRESCENT FOR SPORTS. LYNWORTH SCHOOL IS THE NEWEST OF THE THREE, BEING BUILT ON THE SITE OF LYNWORTH FARM IN 1953. IT IS FORTUNATE TO HAVE A SITE OF 6 ACRES OF PLAYING FIELDS SURROUNDING THE BUILDINGS. THERE ARE 188 CHILDREN IN THE SCHOOL.
